text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Hradec Králové Region | native_name = Královéhradecký kraj | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Hradec Králové od soutoku.JPG | image_flag = Flag of Hradec Kralove Region.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Hradec Kralove Region CoA CZ.svg | shield_size = | image_map = Královéhradecký kraj in Czech Republic.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Czech Republic | seat_type = Capital | seat = Hradec Králové | parts_type = Districts | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = (ČSSD) | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 4758.54 | elevation_m = | elevation_max_m = 1603| elevation_min_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 557000 | population_as_of = 2024-01-01 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = CZ-KR | registration_plate = H | website = www.khk.cz }} Hradec Králové Region is an administrative unit (kraj) of the Czech Republic. The capital city is Hradec Králové. Karkonosze and Orlické mountains are in the north of the region. Two thirds of the area of the Karkonosze National Park is within the region. ==Administrative divisions== Hradec Králové Region is divided into 5 districts: ==Places of interest== *Adršpach-Teplice Rocks *Broumov and its monastery *Dvůr Králové Zoo *Hradec Králové *Josefov Fortress *Kost Castle *Krkonoše National Park *Prachov Rocks *Probošt's mechanical Christmas crib *Ratibořice ==References==
title: Hradec Králové Region
